text: Father of murder victim Polly Klaas said @GavinNewsom death penalty moratorium was “outrageous” & "Trumpian in nature." "This is somebody using an ...imperial executive order based on a whim to turn around the law as it exists & the will of the people”
author: MaeveReston

text: Gov @GavinNewsom on the price of enforcing the death penalty in CA since 1978: "$5 billion could have bought a lot of justice…a lot of training to right the wrongs of a criminal justice system that is skewed against black and brown people."
author: MaeveReston

text: Technically the moratorium on the death penalty in California doesn’t change the fact that it’s the law. To change that, repeal of the death penalty would have to be put on the ballot again. It’s failed twice, 2012 and 2016. Might be on the ballot in 2020.
author: MaeveReston

text: Before he took office, @GavinNewsom said the death penalty was an abstract question. Now he’s the backstop for the taking of a life: “It’s a very emotional place. This is about who I am as a human being. To me, this is the right thing to do."
author: MaeveReston

text: The new death penalty moratorium in California imposed by @GavinNewsom will not commute the sentences of anyone on death row. The equipment used for executions at San Quentin is being dismantled “as we speak,” he says.
author: MaeveReston

text: “I did this with a heavy heart,” @GavinNewsom says of placing the death penalty moratorium in California, noting he has met with victims on all sides of the issue. He says one mother said to him “How dare you.” Another said "This about eradicating evil.”
author: MaeveReston

text: California would be lining up 737 death row inmates for execution if the executions resume, @GavinNewsom - he notes that essentially like killing one person every day for two years.
author: MaeveReston

text: "You as taxpayers have spent $5 billion" since the CA death penalty was reinstated, @GavinNewsom says: “What have we gotten for that?”
author: MaeveReston

text: “I think we’re better than this,” @GavinNewsom says of the moratorium he’s placed on the CA death penalty. "I lived throught the super predator era, three strikes and you’re out,” he says. Now, the "pendulum is swinging in the other direction"
author: MaeveReston

text: You can watch @GavinNewsom announcement live here —>
author: MaeveReston

text: “This has been a 40 year journey for me,” @GavinNewsom says after announcing that he has formally signed a moratorium on the death penalty in California.
author: MaeveReston

text: Gov. Gavin Newsom will sign an executive order Wed placing a moratorium on the death penalty in California. Policy will serve as an instant reprieve for the 737 people on death row in California, which has the largest death row population in the nation http://www.cnn.com/2019/03/12/politics/gavin-newsom-california-death-penalty/index.html …

text: “Russia interfered with the election for President of the United States,” @KamalaHarris says to applause. Vows to stop that from happening again. “By the way, I believe the President of the United States should respect the intelligence community over Putin” (more applause)

text: Setting a marker on the Latino vote here in North Las Vegas  @emmyruiz offered headsets to all the Spanish-speakers in the audience and encouraged them to ask questions in Spanish at this @KamalaHarris rally

text: So Boyz II Men are still performing show. Wow. #ThingsYouLearnInVegas
author: MaeveReston

text: And @StarJones asks @KamalaHarris when she first knew that she had Black Girl Magic. Harris says "The moment that I feel it. It’s a reflective moment,” like the one she sees RN looking at a room of powerful black women "When we see it in each other, I think that’s when we see it"
author: MaeveReston

text: In Vegas, @StarJones asks @KamalaHarris what she would do if she could use her black girl magic and “Make one thing, Poof, just go away.” @KamalaHarris answers “Poverty"
author: MaeveReston

text: In answer to Q here in Vegas about expanding the financial literacy within the middle class, @KamalaHarris says she would expand Pell Grants and make them available in the summer, in addition to the school year.
author: MaeveReston

text: On deciding to become a joyful warrior in 2017, @KamalaHarris says “Find time to sing, Find time to dance, Find time to spend time with friends,” while you’re in the thick of the fight.
author: MaeveReston

text: On that @DeidreDeJear hire, @StarJonesEsq jokes that she didn’t know there were that many black people in Iowa: "I was like what girl?” The audience of black women here at the Women in Power Summit laugh.
author: MaeveReston

text: "In Iowa,” @KamalaHarris adds "the chair of my operation is a black woman.” Everyone was surprised, she said, b/c Iowa is mostly white. "But if you look at her skill set and her experience she is one of the strongest state director anyone could have,” Harris says of @DeidreDeJear
author: MaeveReston

text: In addressing how she picks people for her team, @KamalaHarris notes it is “an extremely diverse team — not only in terms of race and gender" — but in capability and talent.
author: MaeveReston

text: .@KamalaHarris notes that people initially made assumptions that she wouldn’t compete in Iowa and New Hampshire – “There is an assumption that demographically we can’t do well in New Hampshire,” she says, but she notes that’s where she’s drawn some of her biggest crowds
author: MaeveReston

text: "We are undergoing an industrial revolution,” @KamalaHarris says in Las Vegas, noting that some 40% of US jobs will eventually disappear. "People are acutely aware" their jobs are disappearing. Instead of dealing, she says we are scapegoating parents and children crossing border.
author: MaeveReston

text: "Quite Frankly, they don’t trust us to handle it,” @KamalaHarris says of young activists, particularly those who are advocating for action on climate change. Says their voices must be heard.
author: MaeveReston

text: Asked how keep young voters engaged after the 2018 elections, @KamalaHarris says “We have to listen to them.” She cites student gun safety activists at Parkland & in Chicago. "We have to not try to script them, not try to mold them in our image, because their voices are powerful”
author: MaeveReston

text: Explaining about her decision to go from being a line prosecutor into politics, @KamalaHarris talks about her re-entry program and how she didn’t have to ask anyone to start it and do it her way: "It’s good to be in a position where you don’t have to ask anyone for permission."

author: MaeveReston

text: “No, I am not for free four-year college for all” @amyklobuchar says. She says she wishes she was a “genie” and could make it happen. But “We have a mounting debt,” she says during @CNN town hall. Doesn’t want to leave that debt on their shoulders.
author: MaeveReston

text: Asked whether she supports free college for all, @amyklobuchar talks about refinancing & getting more kids into community college. So I think the answer is No. Says she wants to have a “big discussion”
author: MaeveReston

text: I have to say that dozens of women on the campaign trail in recent weeks have told me how exasperated they are about the careful line that female candidate have to walk: tough but not too tough, strong but not too strident, fierce but not shrill. Clinton’s struggles def live on.
author: MaeveReston

text: Asked by @donlemon about her experiences with her dad drinking & driving and swerving. @amyklobuchar says those experiences shaped her: Obstacles aren’t just obstacles, they are your path, she says.
author: MaeveReston

text: And @amyklobuchar said her dad’s story also taught her a great deal about redemption. “We need to make sure that we are there for people,” she says of people with substance abuse issues.
author: MaeveReston

text: At the CNN Town Hall, @amyklobuchar delves into her deeply personal story about growing up with a dad who was an alcoholic. As a prosecutor, she said she went on to work on DUIs to help others.
author: MaeveReston

text: I would. I also ask former and current aides about how a candidate treated them, male or female. We’ve written about lots of male candidates who were bad bosses.
author: MaeveReston

text: “Am I a tough boss, yes” @amyklobuchar says during our @CNN Town Hall. “Have I pushed my staff too hard, yes” but she says she has high expectations for her staff and the country. I don’t feel like that fully answers the question about her treatment of staff.
author: MaeveReston

text: Right now @amyklobuchar is being asked in our @CNN town hall about her alleged rough treatment of staff. She starts by saying she loves her staff. This seems like a very long-winded answer.
author: MaeveReston

text: This is the most interesting divide in the Democratic field, @amyklobuchar stops short of endorsing Medicare-for-All. She says maybe someday but right now she’s focused on something that would work now.
author: MaeveReston

text: The “We can almost see Canada from our porch” line is definitely working for @amyklobuchar when she talks about her legislation to allow Medicare to negotiate lower prices for prescription drugs
author: MaeveReston

text: In her first @CNN town hall @amyklobuchar says she didn’t expect it to be 17 degrees when she announced in front of the Mississippi River. When people brought her up to me in South Carolina this weekend it was generally as “that lady who announced in the snow” … “that was crazy"
author: MaeveReston

text: Many in California GOP and national party leaders wanted Duncan Hunter to step aside months ago, so they would have time to advance another GOP candidate and save CA-50 for the GOP. Hunter was defiant, and that didn’t happen. Now, too late to even push a write-in candidate
author: MaeveReston

text: But decision by @SpeakerRyan to strip Hunter of his committee assignments says a lot about where the Republican Party stands right now on @Rep_Hunter who has always been a lone wolf.
author: MaeveReston

text: So far, it looks like @Rep_Hunter will stay on and fight the charges. His spox says he believes the charges against him and his wife are “purely politically motivated.” His lawyers face a steep hill given the detail in that 47 page indictment.
author: MaeveReston

text: To underscore political importance of indictment of Duncan D. Hunter to balance of power: Republicans cannot —at this point - put up another candidate. His name will be on the ballot no matter what. Unless a judge orders removal, which would be extraordinary (Per CA Sec of State)
author: MaeveReston

text: In making case that Duncan D. Hunter and his wife lived well beyond their means, prosecutors say they overdrew their personal bank account more than 1,100 times over a 7-year-period. Indictment says that resulted in $37,761 in bank fees
author: MaeveReston

text: At this juncture, Duncan Hunter’s name will remain on the ballot regardless of what he chooses to do. No other GOP candidate can run for CA-50. The only way to remove his name is if that is ordered by a judge. That is a huge development in race for control of US House.
author: MaeveReston

text: President Obama stresses that Iraq was a sovereign government and many Iraqis did not want U.S. troops to stay in #Iraq
author: MaeveReston

text: This is an interesting discourse from President Obama saying that people are unfairly blaming him for drawing down troops in Iraq
author: MaeveReston

text: To clarify, when Obama was talking abt how Iraq is a "long term project" he was referring to limitations of Iraqi gov't to deal w/ situation
author: MaeveReston

text: "This is going to be a long term project" President Obama says of the attempt to deal w/ Isis in #Iraq. Not weeks "It's going to take time"
author: MaeveReston

text: On the question of whether he underestimated #Isis, Obama says U.S. intelligence forces did not anticipate how quickly Isis would expand
author: MaeveReston

text: President Obama says Iraqi Security Forces were clearly not prepared to fight and stand their ground against #Isis when far from Baghdad
author: MaeveReston

text: Once again, almost as though the focus of Obama's remarks is on the fact that this WILL NOT be a U.S. boots on the ground situation in #Iraq
author: MaeveReston

text: Obama stresses Iraqis need to get gov't together, until then hard to get "unity of effort" that allows U.S. to play defense AND offense
author: MaeveReston

text: Ultimately there is not going to be an American military solution to #Iraq problem, President Obama says, must be handled by Iraqi Gov't
author: MaeveReston

text: Part of first priority, President Obama says, is protecting Americans in Iraq.
author: MaeveReston

text: Obama says 1st priority is to deal with this humanitarian situation, preventing #Isis from going up a mountain and "slaughtering" people
author: MaeveReston

text: 1st Q to Obama: Is goal in #Iraq to contain #Isis or destroy it. Obama says he cannot give timetable on how long airstrikes will continue
author: MaeveReston

text: Ultimately only Iraqis can restore stablity to #Iraq, President Obama says, America cannot do that for them.

text: President Obama is listing his various calls to leaders around the world, emphasizing international cooperation in #Iraq
